messages.subject: Re: newbie
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Rich, Well, I guess that is what I am trying to figure out. I want to start out with Koto, mainly so I can get a better grip on understanding construction
messages.messageBody:
Hi Rich,
Well, I guess that is what I am trying to figure out. I want to start
out with Koto, mainly so I can get a better grip on understanding
construction and the ability to identify period and smith. I plan on
joining a few clubs within the following months. Unfortuately, none
are really close enough to attend regularly, with the exception of
the one in LA.
I am going to miss the San Fran show, but will make Chicago, and I am
relly looking forward to it.

Thanks
Alex

Mike,
Plan on going tothe show in Chicago. Really wanted to make the San
Fran show, but just couldn't swing it. I appreciate the direction!

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] newbie
messages.msgSnippet: HI Alex, do you want to collect anything in particular or everything Nihonto related. You didn t really say. Rich Stein has a great web site full of Info
messages.messageBody:
HI Alex, do you want to collect anything in particular or everything
Nihonto related. You didn''t really say. Rich Stein has a great web site
full of Info http://www.geocities.com/alchemyst/nihonto.htm

The sword shows are great, so are the club's. I recommend the Northern
Californian Japanese sword Club.

http://www.ncjsc.org/ncjsc_library.htm

welcome to the Club.

Rich Turner

messages.subject: RE: [nihontostudy] newbie
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Alex and welcome, My advice would be to come to a sword show.  Next month in San Fran, Sept there is one in the Chicago area, and Feb down in Florida.
messages.messageBody:
Hi Alex and welcome,
My advice would be to come to a sword show. Next month in San Fran, Sept
there is one in the Chicago area, and Feb down in Florida. Check Rich's web
site on reputable dealer links to thier websites.
Mike

messages.subject: newbie
messages.msgSnippet: Hello all! I am new to collecting, but have been interested ever since I was little. I have picked up several books (and yes, read them) and came to the
messages.messageBody:
Hello all!
I am new to collecting, but have been interested ever since I was
little. I have picked up several books (and yes, read them) and came
to the realization that the only way to start expanding my
understanding from this point is to start making some purchases. The
question I pose to all here is this:
Is there any one thing that a new collector should look for above all
else when making a buy?
Now, I know this is a very generalized question, but I need to start
somewhere.

Thanks all!

Alex Bivin

BTW - Would like to thank Mr. Stein for his excellent website! It was
largely thanks to you that I understand what little I do!
